# Spikes

> Spikes is a feedback tool for AI-assisted building. Click elements, leave comments, get exact CSS selectors your AI agent can act on. Structured JSON output for Claude Code, Cursor, and other AI coding assistants.

## Key Concepts

- **Widget**: Drop-in JavaScript (`<script src="https://spikes.sh/widget.js">`) that adds a feedback button to any HTML page
- **CLI**: Rust binary for querying feedback, injecting widget, serving locally
- **Feedback format**: JSON with selector, rating (love/like/meh/no), comments, reviewer, timestamp
- **Two workflows**: (1) You reviewing agent work, (2) Collecting feedback from others

## Docs

- [Documentation](https://spikes.sh/docs.html.md): Complete CLI reference, widget configuration, data formats
- [Quick Start](https://spikes.sh/docs.html.md#quick-start): Get running in 30 seconds

## CLI Commands

- `spikes inject <dir>`: Add widget to HTML files
- `spikes serve`: Start local dev server (default port 3847)
- `spikes list`: List all feedback (supports --json, --rating, --page filters)
- `spikes list --json`: Machine-readable output for AI agents
- `spikes hotspots`: Find most-spiked elements
- `spikes export --format json`: Export all feedback

## Data Format

```typescript
interface Spike {
  id: string;                    // nanoid
  type: "page" | "element";
  selector?: string;             // CSS selector for element spikes
  rating: "love" | "like" | "meh" | "no" | null;
  comments: string;
  reviewer: { id: string; name: string };
  timestamp: string;             // ISO 8601
  page: string;
  viewport: { width, height };
}
```

## Installation

```bash
# Install CLI
curl -fsSL https://spikes.sh/install.sh | sh

# Or via Cargo
cargo install spikes
```

## Widget Configuration

```html
<script 
  src="https://spikes.sh/widget.js"
  data-project="my-project"
  data-position="bottom-right"
  data-endpoint="https://my-backend.workers.dev/spikes"
></script>
```
